question:
In a certain code language,
‘A + B’ means ‘A is the sister of B’,
‘A – B’ means ‘A is the brother of B’,
‘A × B’ means ‘A is the father of B’,
‘A ÷ B’ means ‘A is the wife of B’.
Based on the above, how is P related to T if ‘P + Q ÷ R × S − T’?
solution:
(b)

P is the sister of T’s mother.

Some carrots are onions.

All potatoes are radish.

solution:
(c)
cat dog monkey → 55 66 88
camel cat donkey → 66 99 33
dog goat tiger → 88 11 22
From above coding the code for ‘monkey’ is 55.

question:
Which two numbers should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?
17 × 7 + (21 ÷ 3) × 5 – 28 + 34 = 72
(NOTE : Numbers must be interchanged and not the constituent digits e.g. if 2 and 3 are to be interchanged in the equation 43 × 3 + 4 ÷ 2, then interchanged equation is 43 × 2 + 4 ÷ 3)
solution:
(d) Given :- 17 × 7 + (21 ÷ 3) × 5 - 28 + 34 = 72
After going through all the options, option (d) satisfies. After interchanging 7 and 3 we get
17 × 3 + (21 ÷ 7) × 5 - 28 + 34
51 + 3 × 5 + 6
51 + 15 + 6 = 72
L.H.S. = R.H.S.

question: The age of a father will be double the age of his son ten years later. 10 years ago, the father’s age was six times the age of the son. How many years from now, the ratio of their ages will be 3 : 2 ?
solution:
(c)
Let present age of father be x and son be y
10 year later -
(x + 10) = 2(y + 10)
x - 2y = 10 -----(i)
10 year ago -
(x - 10) = 6(y - 10)
x - 6y = - 50-----(ii)
By the equation (i) - equation (ii) we get;
4y = 60 ⇒ y = 15
Put y = 15 in equation (i) we get;
x - 2 (15) = 10 ⇒ x = 40
So, present age of father and son be 40 and 15 respectively
Now, let after 'T' years ratio of their age be 3 : 2
Then, 40+T15+T = 32
80 + 2T = 45 + 3T ⇒ T = 35 years

question:
Select the option that represents the correct order of the given words as they would appear in an English dictionary.
1. Consistence
2. Conscience
3. Conflagration
4. Consequence
5. Considerable
6. Consignment
solution:
(c) The correct order is :-
Conflagration(3) → Conscience(2) → Consequence(4) → Considerable(5) → Consignment(6) → Consistence(1)

question: In which city of Maharashtra is Kalidasa Festival organised every year?
solution: (b) Nagpur. Kalidas Festival is organized in the honor of great poet Kalidas in the month of November. Festivals of Maharashtra: Banganga Festival (Mumbai), Bhaubeej, Jiviti Puja, Pola Festival, Ganesh Chaturthi, Narali Poornima, and Vat Poornima.

question: The victory of the ________ marked the foundation stone of the Delhi Sultanate in India.
solution: (d) Turks. The Delhi Sultanate, an Islamic empire based in Delhi, spanned much of the Indian subcontinent for 320 years from 1206 to 1526. It was founded by Qutb-ud-din Aibak in 1206, marking the beginning of the Mamluk Dynasty.

question: In which of the following places is the Losar Festival celebrated?
solution: (c) Ladakh. It marks the beginning of the New Year for the Tibetan calendar. It is also celebrated in Arunachal Pradesh by the Memba tribe for five days. Other festivals of Ladakh - Hemis Tsechu, Sindhu Darshan Festival, Saka Dawa Festival, Phyang Tserup, etc. Arunachal pradesh - Siang River Festival, Ziro Festival, Solung Festival, Nyokum Festival, etc.

question: As of August, 2023, which of the following states has India’s first fully functionally literate district?
solution:
(a) Madhya Pradesh.
Tribal-dominated Mandla region has become the first fully “functionally literate” district in the country.

question: Which substance is fortified with Calcium, Vitamin D and Vitamin B12 ?
solution: (d) Soy milk. Vitamin D helps our body to use calcium for bones and teeth. It is a Fat-soluble vitamin (A, D, E, and K). Food Sources - Cod liver oil, Egg yolk, Fortified cereals, Tuna fish. Deficiency disease - Rickets. Vitamin B12 (Scientific name - Cobalamin) is a water-soluble vitamin (C and B complex). Sources - Fish, Meat, Poultry, Eggs, and Dairy products. Deficiency disease - Pernicious anemia.

question: Vilayat Khan is known for playing which of the following instruments ?
solution: (d) Sitar. Famous Indian musicians with instruments: Sitar- Pt Ravi Shankar, Shahid Parvez Khan. Santoor - Pt Shiv Kumar Sharma, Bhajan Sopori. Sarod - Allauddin Khan, Ali Akbar Khan. Violin - MS Gopalakrishnan, Smt M Rajam.

question: From which country is the power of judicial review taken in the Indian Constitution?
solution: (b) United States of America. Sources of Indian Constitution: USA- Fundamental Rights, Functions of president and vice-president, Impeachment of the president. UK- Legislative procedure, Single citizenship, Cabinet system, Bicameralism. France- Concept of “Republic”. Japan- Concept of “procedure established by Law”.

question: Which Indian cricketer has written the book ‘The Test of My Life’?
solution: (a) Yuvraj Singh. His awards: Arjuna Award (2012), Padma Shri (2014). Autobiographies of cricketers: Sachin Tendulkar - “Playing It My Way”, Shane Warne - “No Spin”. Sunil Gavaskar - “Sunny Days”, Rickey ponting - “Ponting: At the Close of Play”, Sourav Ganguly - “A Century Is Not Enough”. Kapil Dev - " The Straight from the Heart".

question: Choose the correct group of greenhouse gases.
solution: (c) CH4, N2O, CO2, O3. Greenhouse gases - It absorbs infrared radiation (net heat energy) emitted from Earth’s surface and reradiates it back to Earth’s surface. Kyoto Protocol - It operationalizes the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change by committing industrialized countries and economies in transition to limit and reduce greenhouse gases (GHG) emissions.

question: When is Guru Nanak Jayanti celebrated in India as per the Hindu lunar calendar?
solution: (a) Kartika Poornima. Guru Nanak Jayanti (also known as Gurpurab) is sikh festival. It is observed as the birthday of the first guru, Guru Nanak. The founder of Sikhism was Guru Nanak. Famous sikh festivals and months: Maghi (Magh), Hola Mohalla (Chaitra), Lohri (Pausha), Sodal Mela (Bhadon).

question: Shree Hanuman Vyayam Prasarak Mandal is situated in _______.
solution: (c) Amravati. Shree H. V. P. Mandal, established in 1914 and is registered under Bombay Public Trust Act 1950 and Societies Registration Act 1860. It is a Voluntary, Social, Non-Political & Secular Institute, managed with democratic principles & practices.

question: A _________ is one billionth of a metre.
solution: (d) nanometre. In the International System of Units, the prefix "nano" means one-billionth, or 10-9. Special length units for short and large lengths are: 1 micrometre (µm) = 10–6 m; 1 fermi (f) = 10–15 m; 1 angstrom ( Å) = 10–10 m; 1 astronomical unit (AU) (average distance of the Sun from the Earth) = 1.496 × 1011 m; 1 light year (ly) = 9.46 × 1015 m (distance that light travels with velocity of 3 × 108 m s–1 in 1 year); 1 parsec = 3.08 × 1016 m (Parsec is the distance at which average radius of earth’s orbit subtends an angle of 1 arc second).

question: Swami Vivekananda established which of the following social organisations in 1897?
solution: (d) Ramakrishna Mission - Named after Ramakrishna Paramhansa (Swami Vivekananda’s guru). Aim: Salvation through social service and selfless action. Other Organizations for reform: The Brahmo Samaj (1828), The Prarthana Samaj (1867), The Veda Samaj (1864), and The Mohammedan Anglo-Oriental College (1875).

question: Which of the following awards is given in the field of dance by the government of Madhya Pradesh?
solution: (b) Kalidas Samman was first awarded in 1980. First recipients: Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer and Mallikarjun Mansur. Sanatan Sangeet Sanskriti award recognizes services rendered in music and dance. Nandi Awards (Andhra Pradesh government) recognise excellence in Telugu cinema, Telugu theater, and Telugu television.

question: The height of the net in volleyball for women must be ________.
solution: (a) 2.24 m. Volleyball net height for men: 2.43m. Net width: 1m. Court dimensions: 18m × 9m. Other sports: Football field: Maximum length - 120 m, maximum width - 90m, minimum length - 90 m, minimum width - 45 m. Hockey field dimension: 91.4 m × 55 m. Tennis field dimension: 23.77 m × 8.23 m (single) and 23.77 m × 10.9 m (doubles).

question: Table sugar mostly contains
solution: (b) sucrose. Natural disaccharide found in fruits, honey, and vegetables; composed of glucose and fructose. Maltose - Disaccharide of two glucose molecules. Fructose - Ketohexose obtained from the hydrolysis of sucrose, along with glucose. Glucose - A component of sucrose, forming the disaccharide along with fructose.

question: The first edition of Indian Women's Premier League (cricket) was held in the year ________ .
solution: (b) 2023. The Women's Premier League (WPL), also known as the TATA WPL for sponsorship reasons, is a women's Twenty20 cricket franchise league in India, owned and operated by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). Mumbai Indians won the first season, led by Harmanpreet Kaur. The 2024 Women's Premier League: Winner - Royal Challengers Bangalore.

question: In India, "APEDA" is related to which of the following?
solution: (b) Agriculture. The Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) was established by the Government of India under the Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority Act passed by the Parliament in December, 1985. The act came into effect on February 13, 1986.

question: Which Five-Year Plan was formulated by governments of two political parties?
solution: (b) Sixth Five-Year Plan (1980-1985): Led by Indira Gandhi. Targeted growth - 5.2%, Achieved - 5.7%. Fifth Five Year Plan (1974 -1978) : This plan was terminated in 1978 by the newly elected Moraji Desai government. Targeted growth - 4.8 %, Achieved - 4.4 %. Eighth Five Year Plan (1992- 1997): leadership by V. Narasimha Rao. Targeted growth - 5.6 %, Achieved - 6.8 %.

question: What kind of image does the eye lens form of the object on the retina?
solution: (a) Inverted real image. The human eye lens acts like a convex lens, which means it converges light rays. The image formed by a convex lens on the retina is real because it can be projected onto a screen.

question: What is the name of the earliest form of writing known in the Indian subcontinent?
solution: (b) Indus Script. It is also known as the Harappan script and the Indus Valley Script, is a corpus of symbols produced by the Indus Valley Civilisation. Sumerian cuneiform and Egyptian hieroglyphs are generally considered the earliest true writing systems.

question: The Election Commission of India became a three-member body in 1989, again it was made into a single member body in the year _________ .
solution: (a) 1990. Evolution of the Election Commission of India (ECI): Single-member body from 1950 to 15th October 1989. ECI became a three-member body from 16th October 1989 to 1st January 1990. ECI was a single-member body from 2nd January 1990 to 30th September 1993. ECI returned to a three-member Body from 1st October 1993 onwards.

question: Which of the following is/are NOT a part of the financial sector?
solution: (a) Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare. Parts of Financial System - Financial Assets, Financial Intermediaries/Financial Institutions, Financial Markets, Financial Rates of Return, Financial Instruments, Financial Services, etc. The Indian financial system is broadly classified into two broad groups - Organized sector and Unorganized sector.

question: Which mountain range includes the Shiwalik range as a part?
solution: (c) Himalayas. The Himalayan mountains are divided into three main parallel ranges: Himadri (Great Himalayas or Inner Himalayas), Himachal (Lesser Himalayas), and Shiwaliks (Outer Himalayas). Western Ghats (Sahyadri): They are a biodiversity hotspot and traverse the States of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat. Eastern Ghat is the discontinuous mountain range that passes through the states of Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.

question: Which of the following structures stores carbohydrates?
solution: (c) Amyloplast. Plastids store carbohydrates as starch. Aleuroplast: Leucoplasts storing proteins. Elaioplast: Leucoplasts storing lipids, fats, and oils. Chloroplast: Organelles in plants and algae cells, responsible for photosynthesis.

question: The distance between the centres of two circles is 81 cm, and their radii are 42 cm and 51 cm. What is the length (in cm) of the direct common tangent to the circles?
solution:
(a)

Length of direct common tangent (PQ) = (AB)2 -(BQ - AP)2 = (81)2-(9)2
= (81+9)(81-9) = (90)×(72) = (18×5)×(18×4) = 18 × 2 5 = 365 cm

question: The average weight of 35 students in a class is 40 kgs. Five of the students of this class whose average weight is 42 kgs left the class. Find the average weight of the remaining 30 students.
solution:
(a)
Average weight of remaining 30 student = 40 - 5 × (42-40)35-5 = 40 - 13 = 39 23kgs

question: Find the length of the sides of a triangle, if its angles are in the ratio 2 : 4 : 6 and its circumradius is 12 cm.
solution:
(d)
Let angles of the triangles be 2x , 4x and 6x
2x + 4x + 6x = 180°
12x = 180° ⇒ x = 15°
Angles of triangle = 30° , 60° , 90°
Ratio of sides = 1 : 3 : 2
Since, one angle is 90° so, triangle is right angled
Now, circumradius of right angle triangle = hypotenuse2
hypotenuse2 = 12 ⇒ hypotenuse = 24 cm
Now, 2 unit = 24 cm , 1 unit = 12 cm
Other sides be 12 cm, 123 cm
Hence, sides are 12 cm, 123 cm, 24 cm

question: The average of 25 integers is zero. What is the maximum possible number of positive integers?
solution:
(d)
Average of 1 negative number = average of 24 positive numbers
{Because here maximum (+ive) integers are asked whereas the average of 25 numbers is zero.}
So the maximum positive integers will be 24

question:
The following table shows the expenditure of a company (in ₹ lakh) per annum over the given years. Study the table and answer the question that follows.

The total amount of bonus paid by the company during the given period is what percentage of the total amount of fuels and transport paid during this period (correct to two places of decimals)?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1738991574633.png
solution:
(d)
Total bonus = 3 + 4.25 + 4.50 + 4.85 + 4.90 = 21.5 lakh
Total amount of fuel and transport = 110 + 145 + 120 + 168 + 190 = 733 lakh
Required % = 21.5733 × 100 = 2.93%

question: If 4sin² θ = 3(1 + cosθ), 0° < θ < 90°, then what is the value of 15 tanθ + 415 sinθ + 2secθ?
solution:
(a)
4sin² θ = 3(1 + cosθ)
4(1 - cos² θ) = 3(1 + cosθ)
4 (1 - cos θ) (1 + cos θ) = 3(1 + cosθ)
(1 - cos θ) = 34
cos θ = 1 - 34 = 14 = basehypotenuse
Perpendicular = 15
Now,
15tanθ + 415 sinθ + 2secθ
15 × Perpendicularbase +415 × Perpendicularhypotenuse + 2 × hypotenusebase
15 × 151 + 415 × 154 × + 2 × 41
15 + 1 + 8 = 24

question: If ƒ(p) = sinp+2 x + cosp+2 x, then the value of 6ƒ(2) - 4ƒ(4) + 10ƒ(0) is:
solution:
(a)
Take x = 45°
6ƒ(2) = 6 × ( sinp+2 x + cosp+2 x)
= 6 × ( sin4x + cos4x)
= 6 × ( (12)4 + (12)4)
= 6 × ( 14 + 14) = 6 × 12 = 3
4ƒ(4) = 4 × ( sin6 x + cos6x)
= 4 × ( (sin2 x)3 + (cos2 x)3)
= 4 × ((12)2)3 + ((12)2)3
= 4 × ( 18 + 18) = 4 × 14 = 1
10ƒ(0) = 10 × ( sin2 x + cos2x)
= 10 × (1) = 10
Hence, 6ƒ(2) - 4ƒ(4) + 10ƒ(0) = 3 - 1 + 10 = 12

question: A shopkeeper marks up the price of the oil by 40% and uses a faulty machine which measures 15% less. If the shopkeeper gives a discount of 32%, the profit/loss percentage is:

The following table shows the total candidates appeared and number of candidates present, in different exam centres – P, Q and R. Study the table and answer the question that follows.

‘Total’ denotes total candidates applied for the centre,‘Present’ denotes the candidates appeared. In which year was the number of absentees the second highest in total of all centres?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1738991574837.png
solution:
(d)
The number of absentees in 2018 = (64 + 65 + 65) - (60 + 45 + 55) = 34
The number of absentees in 2017 = (50 + 75 + 45) - (45 + 55 + 40) = 30
The number of absentees in 2020 = (55 + 80 + 90) - (44 + 66 + 85) = 30
The number of absentees in 2019 = (80 + 84 + 70) - (69 + 72 + 62) = 31
It is clear from the above expression that in 2019 the number of absentees is the second highest in total of all centres.

question: A tank is filled in 45 minutes by two pipes, A and B. Pipe B fills the tank twice as fast as A. How much time (in minutes) will pipe A alone take to fill the tank?
solution:
(a)
Ratio → A : B
Efficiency → 1 : 2
Total work = 45 × 3 = 135
Time taken by Pipe A alone = 1351 = 135 minutes

question: A solid metallic cube having surface area of 54 cm² is melted to form smaller cubes of surface area 812 cm² each. Find the number of smaller cubes.
solution:
(d)
Let the no. of smaller cube be n
Surface area of larger cube = = 54
a12 = 9 ⇒ a1 = 3 cm
Surface area of smaller cube = 6a22 = 812
a22 = 812×6 = 19 ⇒ a2 = 13
Volume of larger cube = n × volume of smaller cube
a13 = n × a23
33 = n × 133
27 = n27
n = 729

question:

23+3(14÷1520+2)-18×132(4+20÷4 )
2{3+3(13+2)-6}2(4+5)
2{3+3(73)-6}2(9 )
2{3+7-6}18
818 = 49

question: If x2 + y2 + z2 = xy + yz + zx, then the value of ( 17x4 + 9y4 + 16z48x2y2 + 6y2z2+10z2x2) is:
solution:
(d)
Let x = y = z = 1
Put the value in the given expression
17x4 + 9y4 + 16z48x2y2 + 6y2z2+10z2x2
= 17(1)4+9(1)4+16(1)48(1)2(1)2+6(1)2(1)2+10(1)2(1)2
= 17+9+168+6+10 = 4224 = 1.75

question: A bigger circle centre at O and a smaller circle centre at P touch each other externally such that the length of their common tangent LM is 12 cm. If the radius of the bigger circle is 18 cm, then what will be the radius (in cm) of the smaller circle?
solution:
(a)

Length of common tangent (LM) = 2r1r2
12 = 2r1×18
144 = r1×72
r1 = 2 cm

question: If (sec A+tan A)sec A-tan A = 25179 then the value of sin A is equal to:
solution:
(d)
(sec A+tan A)sec A-tan A = 25179
(sec A+tan A)sec A-tan A = 20979
By applying componendo and dividendo
sec A tan A = 209+79209-79
sec A tan A = 288130
1cosAsin Acos A = 288130
1sin A = 14465
sinA = 65144

question: A shopkeeper decides to raise the marked price of an article by 40%. How much percentage discount should he allow to be able to sell the article at the original marked price?
solution:
(a)
Let the MP = 100 units
MP after increment = 100 × 140100 = 140 units
Required discount = 140-100140 × 100 = 2847 %

question: Arun and Bhaskar run a race of 3 km. First, Arun gives Bhaskar a head start of 400 m and beats him by 30 seconds. While coming back, Arun gives Bhaskar a lead of 2.5 minutes and gets beaten by 500 m. What is the difference between the times in minutes in which Arun and Bhaskar can run the race for one side separately?
solution:
(b)
Case 1:
Arun : Bhaskar
Distance → 3000 : 2600
Time → t : t + 0.5
Time taken to cover 3000 m = t minutes
For 2500 m = t3000 × 2500 = 5t6 minutes
Case 2:
Arun : Bhaskar
Distance → 2500 : 3000
Time → 5t6 : 5t6 + 2.5
Now speed of Bhaskar will be same for both side
Hence, from case 1 and case 2
2600t+0.5 = 30005t6+2.5
13t+0.5 = 905t+15
65t + 195 = 90t + 45
25t = 150
t = 6 minute
Time taken by arun to travel 3000 m = 6 minute
Time taken by Bhaskar to travel 3000 m = 5t6+2.5 = 7.5 minute
Required difference = 7.5 - 6 = 1.5 minutes

question: Radhika requested the cashier of a bank to get her coins in lieu of her cheque worth ₹1,845. Cashier gave her a packet containing ₹5, ₹10 and ₹20 coins in the ratio of 3 : 5 : 7. What is the total worth of the smallest coin received by her ?
solution:
(a)
Ratio - 5 : 10 : 20
3 : 5 : 7
—--------------------------
Final - 15 : 50 : 140
Total amount = 15 + 50 + 140 = 205 units
205 units = ₹ 1845
(required worth) 15 units = 1845205 × 15 = ₹ 135

question: From the salary of a software engineer, if 15% is used as house rent, 25% of the remaining is spent on household items, 25% of the remaining as income tax, and 15% of the remaining on clothing, then he is left with ₹10,404. Find his total salary.
solution:
(a)
Let salary of software engineer be Rs. x
According to the question,
x × 85100 × 75100× 75100 × 85100 = 10404
x = 10404 × 2017 × 43× 43 × 2017
x = ₹25,600

question: A man invested a sum of ₹5,000 on simple interest for 5 years such that the rate of interest for the first 2 years is 10% per annum, for the next 3 years it is 12% per annum, How much interest (in ₹), will he earn at the end of 5 years?
solution:
(d)
Total interest gain in 5 year = 2 × 10% + 3 × 12% = 56%
So, interest earn at the end of 5 year = 5000 × 56% = 2800

question: If x + 1x= 15, then the value of 7x2-9x+7x2-x+11 is :
solution:
(c)
7x2-9x+7x2-x+1
= 7x-9+7xx-1+1x
= 7(x + 1x)-9(x+1x)-1
= 7×15-915-1
= 9614 = 487

question: Twelve men working for 9 hours a day complete a piece of work in 24 days. In how many days can 8 men working for 12 hours a day complete the same piece of work ?
solution:
(b)
Formula used :- M1D1H1 = M2D2H2
⇒ 12 × 24 × 9 = 8 × x × 12
⇒ x = 12×24×9 8×12 = 27
Hence, required days = 27

question: Ramendra purchased some watermelons for ₹1,500. He sold one-fourth of them at a loss of 12%. At what gain percentage should the remaining watermelons be sold so as to gain 25% on the whole transaction (correct to two decimal places) ?
solution:
(d)
When profit is 25% on whole transaction then amount = 1500 × 125% = ₹ 1875
SP of one-fourth watermelons = 1500 × 14 × 2225 = ₹ 330
According to the question,
1500 × 34 × (x+100)100 = 1875 - 330
45 × (x + 100) = 1545 × 4
(x + 100) = 137.33
x = 37.33%
So, we can say that the remaining watermelons sell at a 37.33% profit.

question:
Study the given table and answer the question that follows.
The table shows the number of students appeared and qualified (in thousands) district-wise in the EMCET examination in a state.

\n

The total percentage of students who qualified in the year 2016 (correct up to two decimals) is:


https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXeP16ZTvO2p_r1upUbG0aDyiHeqe38PPcTnxxjAGJ_Bi-etq_ASodVSJL9TthhGfvwDTpAxuoIeCvTDhsZ3ixIWBRsnAiFilutCZEo0BKZD3J5nqMK7lDpaIYS9yMnHutj_9rLJ?key=V2XySf82cjYQ5JpUeeU2veTy
solution:
(d)
Total number of students in 2016 = 55 + 35 + 48 + 50 + 55 + 60 = 303
Qualified students = 42 + 22 + 26 + 30 + 27 + 19 = 166
Required % = 166303 × 100 = 54.78%

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.
The Supreme Court set away / the verdict of the High Court / and agreed to hear the plea / of the complainant.
solution:
(b) The Supreme Court set away
‘Set away’ must be replaced with ‘set aside’. The phrasal verb ‘set aside’ means to deprive of legal effect because it has been proved wrong. The given sentence states that the Supreme Court set aside the verdict of the High Court. Hence, ‘The Supreme Court set aside’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.
I have been yet to go to the flower exhibition at Delhi University.
solution:
(d) have yet
The given sentence is in the active voice as the subject ‘I’ is the being considered the doer of the action. Therefore, ‘been’ will be removed from the sentence. ‘Have to’ is a semi-modal and takes the first form of the verb(go) after it. Hence, ‘have yet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
In the following questions, out of the four alternatives, choose the one which can be substituted for the given words/sentence.
A person who collects and /or studies stamps.
solution:
(b) philatelist - a person who collects and study postage stamps.
Pioneer - a person who is among the first to explore or settle a new country or area
Pianist - A person who plays the piano.
Philanthropist - a person who seeks to promote the welfare of others, especially by the generous donation of money to good causes.

question:
Select the option that can substitute the bracketed word segment correctly and complete the following sentence meaningfully.
You all need to (get into) the books prescribed in your syllabus.
solution:
(c) go through
‘Go through’ is a phrasal verb which means to study something in detail. The given sentence states that you all need to go through the books prescribed in your syllabus. Hence, ‘go through’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Choose the best alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/ phrase given below as underlined in the sentence.
Sheila's tall tales have no meaning.
solution:
(c) Boasting
Example - My uncle has always been fond of telling tall tales about his time overseas.

question:
Find a word that is the synonym of :
Peculiar
solution:
(b) strange
Peculiar - different to what is normal or expected; strange.
Look at the sentence:
It seems peculiar that he would leave town and not tell anybody.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Find the correct order:
P: The Information Technology today is rightly called the Technology of the Century as it has found its application and use in every walk society of the world.
Q: Distances no longer exist and the world appears to have shrunk into a Global Village.
R: It is really a landmark achievement that more than six billion population of the world will soon be living in a virtual village, as compact as any small Indian village of a few thousand population.
S:The Wisdom of the wisest is today available to the stupidest of the person thus ushering in an era of real equality of opportunity to all.
solution:
(b) PQRS.
Sentence P is the starting line of the parajumble because it tells the subject of the parajumble that is Information Technology. Q will be followed by R as Q mentions about a global village and R further elaborates that.Finally S will be the last sentence.So PQRS is the correct order. So Option (b) is the correct answer.

question: Find the correctly spelt word.
solution: (a) Auxiliary

question:
Choose the word opposite in meaning to the given word.
Controversial
solution:
(c) Undisputed - not disputed or called in question; accepted.
Controversial - giving rise or likely to give rise to controversy or public disagreement.
Example : Abortion is a highly controversial subject.

question:
Choose the best alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/ phrase given below.
The teacher’s announcement to conduct a snap test came as a bolt from the blue to many students.
solution: (b) unexpected

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains grammatical error. Mark ‘no error’ in case the sentence given is correct.
It is better to do not calculate your gains before they are realised.
solution:
(b) to do not calculate your gains
The use of the verb ‘do’ in the former part of the sentence is incorrect. Hence, we will remove ‘do’ & ‘to not to calculate your gains’ becomes the most appropriate answer.

question:
In the following questions, out of the four alternatives, choose the one which can be substituted for the given words/sentence.
Military waking signal sounded in the morning
option_1: Military waking signal sounded in the morning Reveille
solution:
(a) Reveille.
Reveille - a signal sounded especially on a bugle or drum to wake personnel in the armed forces.
Lullaby- a quiet, gentle song sung to send a child to sleep.
Anthem- a rousing or uplifting song identified with a particular group, body, or cause.
Soprano- the highest singing voice.

question: Find the correctly spelt word.
solution: (c) sanctimonious

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech.
'Do you have a fair copy of this document?' The editor asked the reporter.
option_1: The editor asked the reporter whether did he have a fair copy of that document
option_2: The editor asked the reporter whether he had a fair copy of that document
option_3: The editor asked the reporter whether he had had a fair copy of that document
option_4: The editor asked the reporter whether had he had a fair copy of that document.
solution:
(b) The editor asked the reporter whether he had a fair copy of that document.(Correct)
(a) The editor asked the reporter whether did he have a fair copy of that document.(Incorrect Tense)
(c) The editor asked the reporter whether he had had a fair copy of that document.(Repetition of Verb)
(d) The editor asked the reporter whether had he had a fair copy of that document.(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Scientists and politicians are ______ becoming aware of another factor that could seriously threaten the _____balance between production and consumption of food and climate change.
solution:
(a) both; tenuous
Tenuous means very weak or slight.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

\n

The rescue team could have completed the task if there had been uninterrupted power supply.
option_1: The task can have completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
option_2: The task could have been completed by the rescue team if there had been uninterrupted power supply.
option_3: The task could be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
option_4: The task could have to be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.
solution:
(b) The task could have been completed by the rescue team if there had been uninterrupted power supply.(Correct)
(a) The task can have completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.(Incorrect Helping Verbs)
(c) The task could be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.(Incorrect Helping Verbs)
(d) The task could have to be completed by the rescue team if there was uninterrupted power supply.(Incorrect Helping Verbs)

question:
Find a word that is the synonym of
CANTANKEROUS
solution:
(c) Quarrelsome
Cantankerous- bad-tempered, argumentative, and uncooperative.
Cancerous- affected by or showing abnormalities characteristic of cancer.
Ferocious- savagely fierce, cruel, or violent.
Fissiparous- inclined to cause or undergo division into separate parts or groups.

question:
Pick a word opposite in meaning to
Gullible
solution:
(d) Skeptical
Gullible- easily persuaded to believe something.
Skeptical- not easily convinced, having doubts or reservations.
Susceptible- likely or liable to be influenced or harmed by a particular thing.
Cynical- believing that people are motivated purely by self-interest, distrustful of human sincerity or integrity.
Severe- very great, intense.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
He is always angry________ his children.
solution:
(a) with
Structure - “angry with somebody”

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Find the correct order:
P: They must be given or rather 'fed' with coal and given petrol to drink from time to time.
Q : Already man spends most of his time looking after and waiting upon them.
R : Yet he has grown so dependent on them that they have almost become the masters now.
S : It is very true that machines were made for the sole purpose of being man’s servants.
solution:
(d) SRQP
S will be the first sentence and it is immediately followed by sentence R. It tells that although machines were made to serve men, they have almost become masters now. However, next will be the sentence Q followed by sentence P which tells how machines are becoming masters now. Hence, the correct sequence is (d) SRQP.

question:
Cloze Test :
Good taste is not always ___(96)___ and most people manage to get ___(97)___ without it. It is fortunate, therefore, that so many of the ___(98)___ of life are now chosen for us by ___(99)___ Even among luxuries, the margin for ___(100)___ taste is constantly being reduced.
Select the appropriate option to fill in the blank number 96.
solution:
(d) inborn.
An ‘inborn’ quality is one that we are born with. The given passage states that no one is born with good taste. Hence, ‘inborn’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :
Good taste is not always ___(96)___ and most people manage to get ___(97)___ without it. It is fortunate, therefore, that so many of the ___(98)___ of life are now chosen for us by ___(99)___ Even among luxuries, the margin for ___(100)___ taste is constantly being reduced.
Select the appropriate option to fill in the blank number 97.
solution:
(b) along.
The phrase ‘get along’ means to manage to live or survive. The given passage states that no one is born with good taste & people manage to live or survive without it. Hence, ‘along’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :
Good taste is not always ___(96)___ and most people manage to get ___(97)___ without it. It is fortunate, therefore, that so many of the ___(98)___ of life are now chosen for us by ___(99)___ Even among luxuries, the margin for ___(100)___ taste is constantly being reduced.
Select the appropriate option to fill in the blank number 98.
solution:
(d) necessities.
‘Necessities’ means the need for something, the fact that something must be done or must happen. The given passage talks about the necessities of life. Hence, ‘necessities’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :
Good taste is not always ___(96)___ and most people manage to get ___(97)___ without it. It is fortunate, therefore, that so many of the ___(98)___ of life are now chosen for us by ___(99)___ Even among luxuries, the margin for ___(100)___ taste is constantly being reduced.
Select the appropriate option to fill in the blank number 99.
solution:
(c) experts.
‘Expert’ is a person who has a lot of special knowledge or skill. The given passage talks about the necessities of life that are now chosen for us by experts. Hence, ‘expert’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :
Good taste is not always ___(96)___ and most people manage to get ___(97)___ without it. It is fortunate, therefore, that so many of the ___(98)___ of life are now chosen for us by ___(99)___ Even among luxuries, the margin for ___(100)___ taste is constantly being reduced.
Select the appropriate option to fill in the blank number 100.
solution:
(d) personal.
‘Personal’ means of or belonging to one particular person. The given passage states that the margin for personal taste is constantly being reduced. Hence, ‘personal’ is the most appropriate answer.
